description: This application is used to apply for a Midland National fixed annuity contract. You will be asked to provide information about the annuitant, owner, beneficiaries, funding, and product selection. All statements made are representations and become part of the annuity contract. Please have personal identification, Social Security numbers, and funding account information available before beginning.

pages.title: Owner Information
pages.description: Identify the contract owner. If the owner is the same as the annuitant, check the box. Otherwise, enter the owner's information and optionally add a joint owner.

questions.label: Is the owner the same as the annuitant?
questions.hint: Ask whether the annuity owner is the same person as the annuitant. If yes, no additional owner information is needed.

questions.label: Owner Type
questions.hint: Ask whether the owner is an individual person or a trust/corporation.

questions.label: Owner Gender
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's gender as it appears on their legal identification.

questions.label: Owner First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's legal first name.

questions.label: Owner Middle Initial
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's middle initial if applicable.

questions.label: Owner Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's legal last name.

questions.label: Owner Date of Birth
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's date of birth. The owner must be at least 18 years old.

validation.description: Owner must be at least 18 years old

questions.label: Owner SSN / TIN / Employee ID No.
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's Social Security Number or Tax Identification Number. For trusts and corporations, this will be their EIN.

validation.description: Must be a valid SSN (XXX-XX-XXXX) or EIN (XX-XXXXXXX)

questions.label: Trust / Corporation Name
questions.hint: Ask for the full legal name of the trust or corporation that will own this contract.

questions.label: Trust Date
questions.hint: Ask for the date the trust was established. This is required if the owner is a trust.

validation.description: Trust date cannot be in the future

questions.label: Owner Street Address
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's street address. P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed

questions.label: Owner City
questions.hint: Ask for the city of the owner's address.

questions.label: Owner State
questions.hint: Ask for the state of the owner's address.

questions.label: Owner Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's zip code.

questions.label: Owner Phone
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's primary phone number.

questions.label: Will there be a joint owner on this contract?
questions.hint: Ask whether the applicant wants to name a joint owner on this annuity contract.

questions.label: Joint Owner Gender
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's gender.

questions.label: Joint Owner First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's legal first name.

questions.label: Joint Owner Middle Initial
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's middle initial if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Owner Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's legal last name.

questions.label: Joint Owner SSN / TIN
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's Social Security Number.

questions.label: Address and Phone Number Same as Owner?
questions.hint: Ask whether the joint owner's address and phone are the same as the primary owner's.

questions.label: Joint Owner Street Address
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's street address. P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed

questions.label: Joint Owner Date of Birth
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's date of birth.

validation.description: Joint owner must be at least 18 years old

questions.label: Joint Owner City
questions.hint: Ask for the city of the joint owner's address.

questions.label: Joint Owner State
questions.hint: Ask for the state of the joint owner's address.

questions.label: Joint Owner Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's zip code.

questions.label: Joint Owner Phone
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's phone number.

pages.title: Annuitant Information
pages.description: Enter the annuitant's information (the person whose life determines the contract). You may also designate a joint annuitant.

questions.label: Gender
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's gender as it appears on their legal identification.

questions.label: U.S. Citizen
questions.hint: Ask whether the annuitant is a U.S. citizen. A 'No' answer may require additional documentation.

questions.label: First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's legal first name.

questions.label: Middle Initial
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's middle initial if they have one. This is optional.

validation.description: Must be a single letter

questions.label: Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's legal last name.

questions.label: Social Security Number / TIN
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's Social Security Number or Tax Identification Number. This is required for tax reporting purposes.

validation.description: Must be in format XXX-XX-XXXX
Verify SSN against annuitant name and date of birth

questions.label: Street Address
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's physical street address. Remind them that P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed

questions.label: Date of Birth
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's date of birth in MM/DD/YYYY format. The annuitant must be between 0 and 85 years old at the time of application for most Midland National fixed annuity products.

validation.description: Date of birth cannot be in the future
Annuitant cannot be older than 85 at time of application

questions.label: City
questions.hint: Ask for the city of the annuitant's street address.

questions.label: State
questions.hint: Ask for the two-letter state abbreviation of the annuitant's address.

questions.label: Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's 5-digit zip code.

validation.description: Must be a valid 5 or 9-digit zip code

questions.label: Phone Number
questions.hint: Ask for the annuitant's primary phone number including area code.

validation.description: Must be a valid 10-digit US phone number

questions.label: Will there be a joint annuitant on this contract?
questions.hint: Ask whether the applicant wants to add a joint annuitant. Remind them the joint annuitant must be their spouse.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Gender
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's gender as it appears on their legal identification.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant U.S. Citizen
questions.hint: Ask whether the joint annuitant is a U.S. citizen.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's legal first name.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Middle Initial
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's middle initial if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's legal last name.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant SSN / TIN
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's Social Security Number.

questions.label: Address and Phone Number Same as Annuitant?
questions.hint: Ask whether the joint annuitant's address and phone number are the same as the primary annuitant's.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Street Address
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's street address. P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Date of Birth
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's date of birth in MM/DD/YYYY format.

validation.description: Joint annuitant cannot be older than 85

questions.label: Joint Annuitant City
questions.hint: Ask for the city of the joint annuitant's address.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant State
questions.hint: Ask for the state of the joint annuitant's address.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's zip code.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Phone
questions.hint: Ask for the joint annuitant's phone number.

pages.title: Owner Beneficiaries
pages.description: Designate primary and contingent beneficiaries for the owner. Primary percentages must total 100%.

questions.label: Owner Beneficiaries
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to provide details for each beneficiary they want to name. For each beneficiary, collect whether they are primary or contingent, the distribution method (per stirpes or per capita), their full legal name, SSN, date of birth, relationship to the owner, phone number, mailing address, email address, and their percentage of the benefit. Remind them that primary beneficiary percentages must total 100%, and contingent beneficiary percentages must also total 100% if any contingent beneficiaries are named. Per stirpes means that if a beneficiary predeceases the owner, that beneficiary's children inherit their share equally. Per capita means the benefit is split only among surviving beneficiaries.

validation.description: Must be a valid email address

groupValidations.description: Contingent beneficiary percentages must total 100% if any are named

pages.title: Annuitant's Beneficiary Designation
pages.description: When the owner differs from the annuitant, separate annuitant beneficiaries may be designated.

questions.label: Annuitant Beneficiaries
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to provide beneficiary details for the annuitant's death benefit. Collect the same information as the owner's beneficiaries: type (primary/contingent), distribution method, name, SSN, date of birth, relationship to the annuitant, phone, mailing address, email, and percentage. Primary percentages must total 100%.

groupValidations.description: Annuitant primary beneficiary percentages must total 100%

pages.title: Verification of Identity
pages.description: Verify the owner's identity with a valid government-issued ID and employment information.

questions.label: Owner Citizenship Status
questions.hint: Ask the agent to confirm whether the owner is a U.S. citizen or a resident alien. If resident alien, ask for the country of citizenship.

questions.label: Owner Country of Citizenship
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's country of citizenship if they are a resident alien.

questions.label: Owner ID Type Presented
questions.hint: Ask the agent to select the type of government-issued ID the owner presented for identity verification.

questions.label: ID Issuing State
questions.hint: Ask for the state that issued the owner's ID, if applicable.

questions.label: ID Issuing Country
questions.hint: Ask for the country that issued the ID if it is a passport or alien registration card.

questions.label: ID Number
questions.hint: Ask for the identification document number.

questions.label: ID Expiration Date
questions.hint: Ask for the expiration date on the owner's ID. Expired IDs are not acceptable.

validation.description: Expired IDs are not acceptable. The ID must be currently valid.

questions.label: Owner Occupation
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's current occupation or employment status.

questions.label: Employer Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's employer name, or 'Retired' if applicable.

questions.label: Years Employed / Retired
questions.hint: Ask how many years the owner has been employed at their current employer, or how many years they have been retired.

questions.label: Non-Natural Owner Documentation Type
questions.hint: Ask which type of documentation was provided to verify the non-natural entity owner.

pages.title: Product Selection & Tax Status
pages.description: Select the tax qualification, funding methods, and investment allocations for the annuity contract.

questions.label: Tax Status
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to select the tax qualification status for this annuity. Non-Qualified means funded with after-tax dollars. IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, TSA/403(b), and Inherited IRA are tax-advantaged account types. Non-Qualified Stretch and Inherited IRA require additional forms.

questions.label: IRA Contribution Tax Year
questions.hint: Ask for the tax year this IRA contribution is intended for. This is required for IRA, Roth IRA, and SEP IRA contributions.

questions.label: Premium Funding Method(s)
questions.hint: Ask how the applicant plans to fund the premium. They may select multiple methods. Check, 1035 Exchange, Direct Transfer, Qualified Rollover, and Salary Reduction are all valid options.

questions.label: Check Amount
questions.hint: Ask for the dollar amount being submitted by check. Checks must be made payable to Midland National Life Insurance Company.

questions.label: Direct Transfer Amount
questions.hint: Ask for the estimated dollar amount being transferred directly from another financial institution (e.g., CD or Mutual Fund). Must be payable to Midland National Life Insurance Company.

questions.label: 1035 Exchange Amount
questions.hint: Ask for the estimated dollar amount being transferred via 1035 exchange from an existing annuity or life insurance policy.

questions.label: Qualified Rollover Amount
questions.hint: Ask for the estimated dollar amount being rolled over from a qualified employer plan such as a 401(k) or pension.

questions.label: Salary Reduction Amount Per Pay Period
questions.hint: Ask for the dollar amount to be deducted from each paycheck for salary reduction contributions, such as for a TSA/403(b).

questions.label: Multiple Check Handling
questions.hint: Ask the applicant how they want their contract issued when multiple funding sources are being used. 'Issue with first funds' means the contract is issued as soon as the first payment is received. 'Issue with last funds' means the contract waits until all funds are received before issuing.

questions.label: How many 1035 Exchanges, Direct Transfers, or Qualified Rollovers will fund this contract?
questions.hint: Ask the applicant how many separate surrendering companies or accounts will be involved in the 1035 exchange(s), transfer(s), or rollover(s). Each surrendering company requires its own ACORD 1035 Exchange / Rollover / Transfer form. The answer to this question controls how many transfer detail pages will follow.

validation.description: At least one transfer must be entered
A maximum of 10 transfers can be processed on a single application

questions.label: Premium Allocation
questions.hint: Ask the applicant how they would like to allocate their premium across the available crediting strategies and the fixed account. Allocations must total 100% and be entered as whole numbers. Before the applicant chooses, explain each strategy family. For any strategy marked with a strategy fee (Enhanced Participation Rate options), explain that a 1.00% annual fee is deducted from the accumulation value each term — this fee applies even in flat or negative index years, which may reduce the account value below premium. The two-year strategies apply the fee twice (2.00% total over the term). All other index strategies have no fee but are subject to cap rates or participation rates that limit upside. 403(b) loans can only be taken from funds allocated to the fixed account.

validation.description: Total allocation across all crediting strategies must equal 100%

funds.name: Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER — Annual PP Non-Enhanced Participation Rate
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point crediting linked to the Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER. Interest credit equals index gain multiplied by the participation rate. No strategy fee.

funds.name: Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER — Annual PP Enhanced Participation Rate ★
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point with Enhanced Participation Rate linked to the Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER. Higher participation rate in exchange for a 1.00% annual strategy fee deducted from accumulation value each term. If the index is flat or negative, the fee still applies and may reduce account value below premium.

funds.name: NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index — Annual PP Non-Enhanced Participation Rate
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point crediting linked to the NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index. Interest credit equals index gain multiplied by the participation rate. No strategy fee.

funds.name: NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index — Annual PP Enhanced Participation Rate ★
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point with Enhanced Participation Rate linked to the NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index. Higher participation rate in exchange for a 1.00% annual strategy fee. Fee applies even when the index is flat or negative, which may reduce account value below premium.

funds.name: S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index — Annual PP Non-Enhanced Participation Rate
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index. Interest credit equals index gain multiplied by the participation rate. No strategy fee.

funds.name: S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index — Annual PP Enhanced Participation Rate ★
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point with Enhanced Participation Rate linked to the S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index. Higher participation rate in exchange for a 1.00% annual strategy fee. Fee applies even when the index is flat or negative.

funds.name: S&P 500® Index — Annual PP Non-Enhanced Participation Rate
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P 500® Index. Interest credit equals index gain multiplied by the participation rate. No strategy fee.

funds.name: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% ER Index — Annual PP Non-Enhanced Participation Rate
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index. Interest credit equals index gain multiplied by the participation rate. No strategy fee.
funds.index: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index

funds.name: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% ER Index — Annual PP Enhanced Participation Rate ★
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point with Enhanced Participation Rate linked to the S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index. Higher participation rate in exchange for a 1.00% annual strategy fee. Fee applies even when the index is flat or negative.
funds.index: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index

funds.name: S&P 500® Index — Monthly Point-to-Point
funds.description: Monthly Point-to-Point with Cap Rate linked to the S&P 500® Index. Monthly index changes are summed over the term, with each positive month capped at the monthly cap rate. Negative months are uncapped. Interest credit equals the sum of the capped monthly changes, floored at 0%.

funds.name: S&P 500® Index — Annual Point-to-Point Cap
funds.description: Annual Point-to-Point with Cap Rate linked to the S&P 500® Index. Annual index gain is capped at the declared cap rate. Floor of 0% — no negative interest credits.

funds.name: S&P 500® Index — Annual Inverse Performance Trigger
funds.description: Annual Inverse Performance Trigger linked to the S&P 500® Index. Earns a declared fixed rate ONLY when the index ends the year flat or negative. Earns nothing when the index ends the year positive. This strategy performs inversely to the underlying index.

funds.name: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% ER Index — Two-Year PP Participation Rate
funds.description: Two-Year Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index. Interest credit equals the two-year index gain multiplied by the participation rate. Interest is credited at the end of the two-year term.
funds.index: S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index

funds.name: Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER — Two-Year PP Participation Rate
funds.description: Two-Year Point-to-Point crediting linked to the Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER. Interest credit equals the two-year index gain multiplied by the participation rate. Interest is credited at the end of the two-year term.

funds.name: NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index — Two-Year PP Participation Rate
funds.description: Two-Year Point-to-Point crediting linked to the NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index. Interest credit equals the two-year index gain multiplied by the participation rate. Interest is credited at the end of the two-year term.

funds.name: S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index — Two-Year PP Participation Rate
funds.description: Two-Year Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index. Interest credit equals the two-year index gain multiplied by the participation rate. Interest is credited at the end of the two-year term.

funds.name: S&P 500® Index — Two-Year PP Participation Rate
funds.description: Two-Year Point-to-Point crediting linked to the S&P 500® Index. Interest credit equals the two-year index gain multiplied by the participation rate. Interest is credited at the end of the two-year term.

funds.name: Fixed Account
funds.description: Earns interest at a declared fixed rate, credited daily. The initial rate is guaranteed for the first contract year. Future rates are declared annually and will never fall below the minimum guaranteed fixed account interest rate of 0.25%. Not linked to any external index. 403(b) loans can only be taken from funds in this account.

pages.title: Replacement
pages.description: Determine whether this transaction replaces or changes any existing insurance or annuity contract.

questions.label: Do you have any existing or pending life insurance or annuity contracts?
questions.hint: Ask whether the applicant currently has any existing or pending life insurance policies or annuity contracts in force or applied for.

questions.label: Will this annuity replace or change any existing life insurance or annuity contracts?
questions.hint: Ask whether this new annuity is intended to replace, lapse, surrender, or otherwise change any existing life insurance or annuity contract. This triggers important state replacement notice requirements.

questions.label: Existing Contracts Being Replaced
questions.hint: Ask for the company name and contract number for each existing policy or contract being replaced by this annuity.

pages.title: 1035 Exchange / Rollover / Transfer
pages.description: Complete one set of transfer details for each surrendering company or account. This information corresponds to the ACORD 1035 Exchange / Rollover / Transfer Form (ACORD 951e). A separate form will be required for each surrendering company. Funds will be applied to Midland National Life Insurance Company.

questions.label: New / Existing Receiving Contract Number
questions.hint: Ask if the funds should be applied to an existing Midland National contract number. If blank, funds will be applied to a new contract. This is optional.

questions.label: Receiving Carrier DTCC # (for Money Settlement)
questions.hint: Ask for the DTCC number of the receiving carrier if this is a money settlement transaction. This is typically used for broker-dealer or clearing firm transfers. This field is optional for most standard transfers.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Name
questions.hint: Ask for the full legal name of the insurance company, bank, or financial institution that currently holds the contract or account being transferred.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Account / Policy / Contract Number
questions.hint: Ask for the policy, account, or contract number at the surrendering company that will be liquidated or transferred.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Street Address
questions.hint: Ask for the street address of the surrendering company. This may be their business address, mailing address, or overnight address depending on how the transfer will be processed.

questions.label: Address Line 2
questions.hint: Ask for the second line of the surrendering company's address, such as suite or floor number. This is optional.

questions.label: Surrendering Company City
questions.hint: Ask for the city of the surrendering company's address.

questions.label: Surrendering Company State
questions.hint: Ask for the state of the surrendering company's address.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the zip code of the surrendering company's address.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Phone Number
questions.hint: Ask for the surrendering company's phone number.

questions.label: Phone Extension
questions.hint: Ask for the phone extension at the surrendering company, if applicable.

questions.label: Surrendering Company Fax Number
questions.hint: Ask for the fax number of the surrendering company, if available.

questions.label: Surrendering Plan Type
questions.hint: Ask for the tax qualification type of the account being surrendered. This must match the tax status on the main application.

questions.label: Surrendering Product Type
questions.hint: Ask for the type of financial product being surrendered.

questions.label: Estimated Amount of Transfer
questions.hint: Ask for the estimated dollar value of the funds being transferred. This is an estimate — the actual amount may differ based on the surrender value at time of processing.

validation.description: Transfer amount must be greater than zero

questions.label: Surrendering Owner First Name
questions.hint: First name of the current contract owner on the surrendering policy. Must match the owner on this application.

questions.label: Surrendering Owner Middle Name
questions.hint: Middle name or initial of the current contract owner on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Owner Last Name
questions.hint: Last name of the current contract owner on the surrendering policy. Must match the owner on this application.

questions.label: Owner SSN / Tax ID # on Surrendering Contract
questions.hint: Ask for the Social Security Number or Tax ID associated with the owner on the surrendering contract.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Owner First Name
questions.hint: First name of the joint owner on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Owner Middle Name
questions.hint: Middle name or initial of the joint owner on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Owner Last Name
questions.hint: Last name of the joint owner on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Owner SSN on Surrendering Contract
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's SSN on the surrendering contract, if a joint owner was named.

questions.label: Surrendering Annuitant First Name
questions.hint: First name of the annuitant on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Annuitant Middle Name
questions.hint: Middle name or initial of the annuitant on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Annuitant Last Name
questions.hint: Last name of the annuitant on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Insured / Annuitant SSN
questions.hint: Ask for the SSN of the insured or annuitant on the surrendering contract, if they are different from the owner.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Annuitant First Name
questions.hint: First name of the joint annuitant on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Annuitant Middle Name
questions.hint: Middle name or initial of the joint annuitant on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Joint Annuitant Last Name
questions.hint: Last name of the joint annuitant on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Insured / Annuitant SSN
questions.hint: Ask for the SSN of the joint insured or joint annuitant on the surrendering contract, if applicable.

questions.label: Surrendering Contingent Annuitant First Name
questions.hint: First name of the contingent annuitant on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Surrendering Contingent Annuitant Middle Name
questions.hint: Middle name or initial of the contingent annuitant on the surrendering policy.

questions.label: Surrendering Contingent Annuitant Last Name
questions.hint: Last name of the contingent annuitant on the surrendering policy, if applicable.

questions.label: Contingent Annuitant SSN
questions.hint: Ask for the SSN of the contingent annuitant on the surrendering contract, if applicable.

questions.label: Transfer Scope
questions.hint: Ask whether the applicant wants to transfer the full value of the surrendering contract or only a partial amount.

options.label: Partial – transfer a specific amount or percentage
Penalty Free Amount – transfer only the penalty-free withdrawal amount

questions.label: Partial Amount Specified As
questions.hint: Ask whether the partial transfer amount is specified as a dollar amount or a percentage of the contract value.

questions.label: Partial Transfer Dollar Amount
questions.hint: Ask for the specific dollar amount to be transferred from the surrendering contract.

questions.label: Partial Transfer Percentage
questions.hint: Ask for the percentage of the contract value to be transferred.

validation.description: For a full transfer, select 'Full' above. Partial percentage must be less than 100%.

questions.label: Transfer Timing
questions.hint: Ask whether the applicant wants the transfer to occur as soon as possible after all forms are received, or on a specific date. Remind them it is their responsibility to confirm the surrendering company's processing guidelines if a specific date is requested.

options.label: As soon as possible after receipt of all necessary forms

questions.label: Specific Transfer Date
questions.hint: Ask for the specific date on which the applicant wants the transfer to occur. This date must be in the future.

validation.description: Transfer date must be today or in the future

questions.label: I understand that my existing financial institution has the most accurate information to ensure I receive the correct Required Minimum Distribution (RMD). If I do not receive my full RMD, I may be subject to an IRS penalty. If necessary, I will instruct my existing financial institution to either pay my RMD to me now or retain it for distribution later before effecting this transfer.
questions.hint: Read this RMD disclosure to the applicant and ask them to acknowledge it. This is required for any transfer from a qualified account (IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, TSA/403(b), etc.) where RMDs may be applicable.

validation.description: Applicant must acknowledge the RMD disclosure for qualified account transfers

questions.label: I understand this partial 1035 exchange is subject to Revenue Ruling 2003-76 regarding cost basis allocation, and that withdrawals within 180 days of the exchange may affect the tax-free status of the exchange. I certify I am not entering into this transaction to reduce or avoid income tax or early withdrawal penalties. I have been directed to consult my tax or legal advisor before proceeding.
questions.hint: Read this partial 1035 exchange disclosure to the applicant. This is required when a partial 1035 exchange is being performed. Ask them to confirm they understand the tax implications and have been advised to consult a tax advisor.

validation.description: Applicant must acknowledge the partial 1035 exchange disclosures

questions.label: I acknowledge this is a TSA/403(b) to TSA/403(b) direct transfer under IRC Section 403(b), executed from financial institution to financial institution, and that withholding does not apply. I confirm an information sharing agreement is in place with the receiving company.
questions.hint: Read the TSA/403(b) transfer disclosure to the applicant. This is required only for TSA/403(b) to TSA/403(b) transfers.

validation.description: Applicant must acknowledge the TSA/403(b) transfer terms

questions.label: I have read and understand the Disclosures and Acknowledgments section of the ACORD 1035 Exchange / Rollover / Transfer Form, including the assignment of rights, cost basis responsibility, and receiving company liability disclaimers.
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to confirm they have reviewed and understood the full disclosures section of the ACORD transfer form.

validation.description: Applicant must acknowledge the transfer disclosures

questions.label: I have been notified by the IRS that I am currently subject to backup withholding because I have failed to report all interest and dividends on my tax return.
questions.hint: Ask the applicant whether they have been notified by the IRS that they are subject to backup withholding. Most applicants will answer No.

questions.label: Under penalties of perjury, I certify that: (1) the number on this form is my correct taxpayer identification number; (2) I am not subject to backup withholding; (3) I am a U.S. person (including a U.S. resident alien); and (4) I am exempt from FATCA reporting.
questions.hint: Read the full taxpayer identification certification to the applicant and ask them to confirm it is accurate under penalties of perjury.

validation.description: Applicant must certify their taxpayer identification number under penalties of perjury

questions.label: Owner / Plan Administrator / Trustee / Custodian Signature
questions.hint: Ask the owner, plan administrator, trustee, or custodian to provide their electronic signature authorizing this transfer.

questions.label: Owner Signature Date
questions.hint: Confirm today's date as the owner's signature date for this transfer form.

validation.description: Transfer form must be signed today

questions.label: Joint Owner / Co-Trustee Signature
questions.hint: Ask the joint owner or co-trustee to sign the transfer form, if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Owner Signature Date
questions.hint: Confirm today's date as the joint owner's signature date.

validation.description: Signature date must be today

questions.label: Insured / Annuitant Signature (if applicable)
questions.hint: Ask for the insured or annuitant's signature if they are different from the owner and a signature is required by the surrendering company.

questions.label: Spouse Signature (Required in Community Property States: AZ, CA, ID, LA, NV, NM, TX, WA, WI)
questions.hint: Ask if the owner is located in a community property state: Arizona, California, Idaho, Louisiana, Nevada, New Mexico, Texas, Washington, or Wisconsin. If so, and the spouse is not named as 100% primary beneficiary, their signature is required on this transfer form.

questions.label: Spouse Signature Date
questions.hint: Confirm today's date as the spouse's signature date, if a spouse signature is provided.

validation.description: Signature date must be today

questions.label: Employer / Third Party Administrator Name (TSA/403(b) only)
questions.hint: For TSA/403(b) to TSA/403(b) transfers only: ask for the name of the employer or third-party administrator who must authorize this transfer.

questions.label: Employer / Third Party Administrator Title (TSA/403(b) only)
questions.hint: Ask for the title of the authorized employer or TPA representative signing the TSA/403(b) transfer.

questions.label: Employer / Third Party Administrator Signature (TSA/403(b) only)
questions.hint: Ask the employer or TPA to provide their authorized signature for the TSA/403(b) transfer.

questions.label: Employer / TPA Signature Date (TSA/403(b) only)
questions.hint: Confirm today's date as the employer or TPA's signature date.

pages.title: Important Disclosures
pages.description: Please review each of the following disclosures carefully. You must acknowledge each one before the application can be submitted. Some disclosures apply only based on your state of residence or the specific characteristics of this application.

disclosures.title: NAIC Annuity Buyer's Guide
disclosures.description: This federally required guide explains how annuities work, the types of annuities available, and your rights as a purchaser. Review of this guide is required in most states before purchasing an annuity.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge that I have received the NAIC Annuity Buyer's Guide and have had the opportunity to review it prior to signing this application.
acknowledgment.hint: Inform the applicant that the NAIC Annuity Buyer's Guide is a document required by most states before an annuity can be sold. It explains how fixed annuities work, the difference between fixed and variable annuities, and the applicant's rights as a consumer. Ask them to confirm they have received and reviewed the guide. They cannot proceed without acknowledging receipt.

disclosures.title: Free Look Period Notice
disclosures.description: You have the right to return this annuity contract within a specified period after receipt for a full refund. The length of the free look period varies by state.

content.body:
## Free Look Period Notice

You have the right to return this annuity contract for a **full refund of premium paid**, without surrender charges, within the free look period following your receipt of the contract.

| State | Free Look Period |
|-------|------------------|
| California | 30 days |
| Florida | 21 days |
| All other states | 10 days |

To exercise this right, return the contract — along with a written request for cancellation — to Midland National Life Insurance Company at:

> 8300 Mills Civic Pkwy  
> West Des Moines, IA 50266

Or mail to: P.O. Box 10385, Des Moines, IA 50306-0385

The refund will be the greater of the contract value or the premiums paid, as required by your state of issue. For index-linked contracts, the refund may be limited to the premium paid if the index value has declined.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge that I have read and understand the Free Look Period Notice, and that I have the right to return this contract within the applicable period for a full refund of premium paid.
acknowledgment.hint: Read or summarize the free look notice to the applicant. Emphasize that they have the right to return this contract — typically within 10 days of receiving it, or longer in some states like California (30 days) and Florida (21 days) — and receive a full refund. Ask them to confirm they understand this right.

disclosures.title: Fixed Annuity Disclosure
disclosures.description: This disclosure clarifies the nature of a fixed annuity and how interest is credited, including the distinction between guaranteed and non-guaranteed values.

content.body:
## Fixed Annuity Disclosure

A **fixed annuity** credits interest at a rate declared by Midland National Life Insurance Company. The interest rate is **guaranteed** not to fall below the minimum guaranteed interest rate stated in your contract.

Values shown in any illustrations or proposals — other than guaranteed minimum values — are **not guarantees, promises, or warranties**. They are projections based on current non-guaranteed rates and are subject to change.

### If Your Contract Includes a Market Value Adjustment (MVA)

If the contract applied for contains an **Interest Adjustment** (also known as a **Market Value Adjustment**), the benefits and values of this contract may **increase or decrease** based on changes in interest rates at the time of withdrawal. Amounts payable under the contract may be subject to an MVA when:
- The contract is surrendered prior to the end of the surrender charge period; or
- A partial surrender above the free withdrawal amount is taken.

Please review your contract carefully for the specific terms of the MVA provision.

acknowledgment.label: I understand that this is a fixed annuity. I acknowledge that non-guaranteed values shown in any illustrations are not promises or warranties, and that if my contract includes a Market Value Adjustment, my contract values may increase or decrease upon surrender.
acknowledgment.hint: Explain to the applicant that this is a fixed annuity — meaning the insurance company declares an interest rate that is guaranteed not to fall below the contract minimum. Any values shown beyond the guaranteed minimum are projections, not guarantees. If the contract includes a Market Value Adjustment, explain that surrendering early may result in receiving more or less than the contract value depending on current interest rates. Ask the applicant to confirm they understand these terms.

disclosures.title: Qualified Account Tax Disclosure
disclosures.description: This disclosure applies to annuities funded with IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, TSA/403(b), or other tax-qualified funds. It explains that using an annuity inside an IRA provides no additional tax deferral benefit beyond the IRA itself.

content.body:
## Qualified Account Tax Disclosure

You have indicated that this annuity will be funded with **tax-qualified funds** (IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, TSA/403(b), or similar).

**Important:** An annuity held within an Individual Retirement Account (IRA) or other tax-qualified plan does **not** provide any additional federal tax deferral benefit beyond the tax deferral already afforded by the IRA or qualified plan itself.

You should consider whether the annuity's other features — such as death benefit protection, guaranteed income options, or principal protection — justify any additional cost compared to other investment options available within the same type of account.

Midland National recommends you consult with a qualified tax advisor before purchasing this product with qualified funds.

acknowledgment.label: I understand that purchasing an annuity within a tax-qualified account (IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, or TSA/403(b)) does not provide additional federal tax deferral beyond what the account type already provides, and that I have been advised to consult a tax advisor before proceeding.
acknowledgment.hint: Explain to the applicant that because their funds are already in a tax-advantaged account (IRA, Roth IRA, etc.), the annuity wrapper itself does not add further tax deferral. The reasons to use an annuity in an IRA should be based on other features like the death benefit or guaranteed income options — not additional tax benefits. Ask if they understand this distinction and confirm they have had the opportunity to consult a tax advisor.

disclosures.title: Replacement Disclosure and Notice
disclosures.description: This disclosure applies when this annuity will replace or change an existing life insurance or annuity contract. It explains the potential risks and costs of replacing an existing policy.

content.body:
## Replacement Disclosure

You have indicated that this annuity **replaces or changes** an existing life insurance or annuity contract.

### Things You Should Consider Before Replacing

Before replacing your existing contract, consider the following:

1. **Surrender charges** — Your existing contract may impose surrender charges if you surrender or transfer funds before the end of the surrender charge period. These charges reduce the amount available for transfer.

2. **Loss of benefits** — Your existing contract may have features, riders, or guaranteed values that are not available in the new contract, or that may cost more to replicate.

3. **New surrender charge period** — By purchasing a new annuity, you will begin a new surrender charge period. Early withdrawals from the new contract may be subject to surrender charges.

4. **Tax consequences** — If this is a non-1035 exchange replacement, surrendering your existing contract may trigger a taxable event. Consult your tax advisor.

5. **Your right to information** — You have the right to request information about your existing contract's current values, including an in-force illustration, policy summary, and premium payment amounts. Your existing company is required to provide this information within five business days of your request.

Your agent is required to leave you copies of all written or printed sales materials used in the sale of this product. **Please retain all such copies for future reference.**

Any applicable state replacement notice forms must also be completed and provided to you.

acknowledgment.label: By signing, I confirm that I have read and understood the Replacement Disclosure above. I understand the potential risks of replacing my existing contract, including possible surrender charges, loss of existing benefits, a new surrender charge period, and potential tax consequences. I have been advised of my right to request information from my existing carrier and have had the opportunity to do so.
acknowledgment.hint: This is a required signature disclosure for replacement transactions. Read or summarize the full replacement disclosure to the applicant — cover the key risks: surrender charges on the old contract, loss of existing benefits, a new surrender charge period on the new contract, and possible tax consequences if not done as a 1035 exchange. Remind them they have the right to request an in-force illustration from their existing carrier. Ask for their electronic signature to confirm they understood and received this disclosure. This signature is distinct from the application signature on the next page.

disclosures.title: Fraud Warning
disclosures.description: State-required notice that providing false information on an insurance application is a crime.

content.body:
## Fraud Warning

Any person who knowingly presents a **false or fraudulent claim** for payment of a loss or benefit, or who knowingly presents **false information** in an application for insurance, is guilty of a crime and may be subject to **fines and confinement in prison**.

**New Jersey Residents:** Any person who includes any false or misleading information on an application for an insurance policy is subject to criminal and civil penalties.

**Financial Institution Disclosure:** Insurance policies and annuities are **not** a deposit or other obligation of, or guaranteed by, a bank, any affiliate of a bank, or savings association. They are **not insured** by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) or any other agency of the United States, a bank, any affiliate of a bank, or savings association.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge the fraud warning: I understand that knowingly providing false information on an insurance application is a crime subject to fines and imprisonment, and that this annuity is not insured by the FDIC or any government agency.
acknowledgment.hint: Read the fraud warning to the applicant. Make clear that intentionally providing false information on this application is a criminal offense. Also note that annuities are insurance products — not bank deposits — and are not FDIC insured. Ask the applicant to confirm they have heard and understood both the fraud warning and the financial institution disclosure.

disclosures.title: MNL RetireVantage® 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement
disclosures.description: This is the required product-specific disclosure for the MNL RetireVantage 14. It summarizes the key features, risks, and limitations of this fixed index annuity. Both the applicant and the sales representative must sign. Your initials in the box and your signature on this disclosure are required in addition to the application signature.

content.body:
## MNL RetireVantage® 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement

By signing this disclosure, I certify that:

- I have read this annuity disclosure in its entirety and have been provided a brochure that explains the Annuity Contract's benefits, features, and limitations. The features of this Annuity Contract have been explained to me by my Agent/Representative.

- The MNL RetireVantage 14 is a **long-term Annuity Contract** and a surrender charge **up to 10%** as well as a **Market Value Adjustment (MVA)** will apply during the 14-year surrender charge period to any full or partial surrender that exceeds the penalty-free partial withdrawal amount.

- I understand a **surrender during the surrender charge period may result in loss of premium**.

- I understand that if I select a crediting method with a **strategy fee**, the strategy fee will reduce my account value and **may result in a loss of premium** in certain scenarios.

- I understand that interest does **not begin to accrue until the date the Annuity Contract becomes effective**, not the date premium is submitted or received.

- I understand my Agent/Representative will receive a **commission** for the sale of this Annuity Contract.

- I understand I should **consult my tax advisor** about possible tax implications related to the purchase of this Annuity Contract and its features.

- I understand that any values shown, other than the **guaranteed minimum and maximum values**, are **not guarantees, promises, or warranties**.

- I have reviewed the features and understand the intent of this Annuity Contract and agree that it meets my needs. I have assessed my financial situation, including cash for living and other related expenses, and this Annuity Contract is **suitable for my financial needs**.

- I am aware that an Annuity buyer's guide is available in the electronic application output or on the company website.

- I understand certain indexes using an **excess return methodology** only report positive index performance after subtracting a benchmark rate.

- I understand the use of a **volatility control mechanism** with an index may decrease its positive performance and, in turn, the return of any crediting method linked to such an index.

- I understand an index established in the last twenty years includes **"back-casted" performance** before the index's inception. I am aware back-casting and other statistical analysis use simulated analysis and hypothetical circumstances to estimate how the index may have performed prior to its actual existence and that these results should **not be considered indicative of actual results**.

- I understand the various available crediting methods and indexes perform differently in various market scenarios and that there is **no one particular crediting method or index that performs better** in comparison to others across all market scenarios.

---

**Not FDIC/NCUA Insured · Not A Deposit Of A Bank · Not Bank Guaranteed · May Lose Value · Not Insured By Any Federal Government Agency**

acknowledgment.label: Owner initials confirming receipt and review of the MNL RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement (REQUIRED)
acknowledgment.hint: The RetireVantage 14 disclosure requires the owner's initials in the designated box in addition to their full signature. After reading or summarizing each bullet point of the disclosure, ask the applicant to provide their initials to confirm they have received and reviewed the full disclosure. Explain that their initials here, combined with their signature below, constitute their certification of all statements in this disclosure.

disclosures.title: MNL RetireVantage® 14 — Applicant Signature
disclosures.description: Full applicant signature certifying all statements in the RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement. Both the owner and joint owner (if applicable) must sign.

content.body:
By signing below, I certify that all statements in the MNL RetireVantage® 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement are accurate to the best of my knowledge, that I have reviewed all features of the Annuity Contract, and that I understand its intent and suitability for my financial needs.

I confirm I have provided my initials above and that this signature, together with those initials, constitutes my full acknowledgment and authorization of the disclosure.

acknowledgment.label: Owner signature — MNL RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement
acknowledgment.hint: Ask the owner to provide their electronic signature on the RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement. This signature certifies all of the bullet-point statements in the preceding disclosure. The date will be auto-captured as today's date.

disclosures.title: MNL RetireVantage® 14 — Joint Owner Signature
disclosures.description: If there is a joint owner on this application, they must also sign the RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement.

content.body: By signing below, the joint owner certifies all statements in the MNL RetireVantage® 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement and confirms their review of the Annuity Contract's features, limitations, and suitability.

acknowledgment.label: Joint Owner signature — MNL RetireVantage 14 Annuity Disclosure Statement
acknowledgment.hint: If there is a joint owner on this application, ask them to also sign the RetireVantage 14 disclosure statement.

disclosures.title: Index Disclosure Supplement
disclosures.description: This supplement provides required disclosures from the index providers for the four proprietary indices available on the MNL RetireVantage 14: Fidelity Multifactor Yield Index 5% ER, NASDAQ-100 Volatility Control 12%™ Index, S&P Multi-Asset Risk Control 5% Excess Return Index, and S&P 500® Dynamic Intraday TCA Index.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge receipt of the Index Disclosure Supplement and confirm that I have had the opportunity to review the disclosures and disclaimers from Fidelity Product Services LLC, Nasdaq, Inc., and S&P Dow Jones Indices LLC regarding the indices to which my selected crediting strategies are linked.
acknowledgment.hint: The index disclosure supplement contains required legal disclaimers from each index provider whose index the applicant has selected. Summarize the key points: the applicant's premium is never directly invested in any index; the index providers make no warranties about performance; and Midland National reserves the right to substitute a different index if an index is discontinued. Ask the applicant to confirm they have received and reviewed this supplement.

disclosures.title: Strategy Fee Risk Disclosure
disclosures.description: This disclosure is required when the applicant has selected one or more Enhanced Participation Rate crediting strategies that include an annual strategy fee. It explains the specific risk of loss of premium in flat or negative index years.

content.body:
## Strategy Fee Risk Disclosure

You have selected one or more crediting strategies that include a **1.00% annual strategy fee** ("Enhanced Participation Rate" strategies). Before proceeding, please read and confirm your understanding of the following:

### How the Strategy Fee Works

The strategy fee is **deducted from the accumulation value** allocated to this strategy at the end of each term (or earlier, if a surrender or partial withdrawal exceeding the penalty-free amount occurs during the term).

The fee equals:
- **1.00% × term length × beginning-of-term accumulation value** allocated to this strategy
- For a **one-year term**: 1.00% of beginning-of-term value
- For a **two-year term**: 2.00% of beginning-of-term value (1.00% per year × 2)

### Risk of Loss

In exchange for the strategy fee, you receive a **higher participation rate** — meaning you capture more of any positive index gain compared to the non-enhanced version.

However:
- **If the index is flat or negative**, the interest credit for this strategy is zero.
- The strategy fee is **still deducted** even if the interest credit is zero.
- This means your **accumulation value allocated to this strategy will decrease** in flat or negative index years.
- **You may receive less than the premium you paid** if the cumulative fees exceed the total interest credited.

### AV TrueUp Benefit

Your Annuity Contract includes an **Accumulation Value True-Up (AV TrueUp)** benefit during the surrender charge period. At the end of the surrender charge period, if total strategy fees since issue exceed total interest credited across all accounts, the excess is added back to your accumulation value. **Important:** The AV TrueUp benefit does **not** apply if: (1) you have taken any surrender exceeding the penalty-free amount in any year during the surrender charge period, or (2) after the surrender charge period ends.

acknowledgment.label: I understand that the Enhanced Participation Rate crediting strategy I have selected includes a 1.00% annual strategy fee deducted from my accumulation value each term. I understand that if the index is flat or negative, the fee still applies and my accumulation value may decrease below the premium I paid. I understand the AV TrueUp benefit applies only during the surrender charge period and only if I have not exceeded the penalty-free withdrawal amount in any year.
acknowledgment.hint: The applicant has selected one or more Enhanced Participation Rate strategies. Walk through the strategy fee mechanism: the fee is 1% per year of the beginning-of-term value; for a two-year strategy it is 2%. It is deducted even when the index earns nothing. In flat or negative years, the account value will be reduced. Explain the AV TrueUp safety net: at the end of the 14-year surrender charge period, if total fees exceed total interest earned across all accounts, the difference is credited back — but this protection disappears if they ever withdraw more than the penalty-free amount. Ask the applicant to confirm they understand these risks.

pages.title: Signatures
pages.description: All required owner, joint owner, and spouse signatures.

questions.label: I have read and agree to the Owner's Statement, including the Taxpayer ID Certification and FATCA exemption declaration.
questions.hint: Read the full Owner's Statement to the applicant, including the taxpayer ID certification and FATCA declaration. Ask them to confirm they understand and agree to all terms before signing.

validation.description: Owner must acknowledge and agree to the owner's statement before signing

questions.label: I acknowledge the fraud warning: knowingly providing false information in an insurance application is a crime subject to fines and imprisonment.
questions.hint: Read the fraud warning to the applicant and ask them to confirm they have heard and understood it.

validation.description: Applicant must acknowledge the fraud warning

questions.label: Owner's Signature
questions.hint: Ask the owner to provide their electronic signature to certify the application.

questions.label: Joint Owner's Signature
questions.hint: Ask the joint owner to provide their electronic signature.

questions.label: Spouse's Signature
questions.hint: Ask if the owner's spouse would like to provide a signature. This is strongly recommended in community property states (Alaska, Arizona, California, Idaho, Louisiana, Nevada, New Mexico, Texas, Washington, Wisconsin) if the spouse is not named as 100% primary beneficiary. Without this signature, the owner is representing they are not married.

questions.label: Signed at City
questions.hint: Ask for the city where the application is being signed.

questions.label: Signed at State
questions.hint: Ask for the state where the application is being signed.

questions.label: Date Signed
questions.hint: Confirm today's date as the date the application was signed.

validation.description: Signature date must be today's date

questions.label: Owner's Email Address
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's email address for correspondence.

validation.description: Must be a valid email address

questions.label: Joint Owner's Email Address
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's email address.

pages.title: Agent Certification
pages.description: Agent certification and commission split. Replacement company details are captured when applicable.

questions.label: Replaced Company Name
questions.hint: Ask the agent for the name of the company whose contract is being replaced.

questions.label: Writing Agents
questions.hint: Collect information for the writing agent and any co-agents. Each agent must provide their agent number and commission percentage. All agent percentages must total 100%. Up to three agents may be listed.

validation.description: Agent must sign today
